answers.answer: The nausea could be due to any number of things. but Tamoxifen is the first that comes to mind. You might ask your Oncologist if there is something you might take to counteract this side effect.    Regards ....

hi, I am sorry you still have so many problems with the nausea. i don't know if you are taking any medications for it, and also whether you have tried different ones. (my oncologist prescribed about 3-4 different ones so I could take what worked best?) and the medication that I preferred over all the other ones is called Reglan. i just wanted to tell you this in case you are interested. it's very safe, and doesn't make you as drowsy as many of the other ones. it works pretty much by speeding up the emptying process of food in your stomach. (i.e. chemo really slows that down, and some people with diabetes also have difficulty with this proces) Anyway, it really helped me. kat  PS: also make sure you are not dehydrated.

question: I have had mastectomy (MRM) of right breast &  6 cycles of chemo( FEC & Taxotere) . I  started on tamoxifen (started on Feb 1st 2009 - its two months now) . Also have gone for 28 rounds of radiation.(ended on March 12th 2009)..Life is normal but nausea continues...What could be the reason? Is it tamoxifen or I still have some thing in my body? Would really appreciate a response.Thanks.
title: nausea continues
